meanings.definition: Involved deeply in a particular activity or interest.
meanings.sent1: She was completely immersed in her favorite book, not noticing anything around her.
meanings.sent2: The artist was so immersed in painting that hours flew by without her realizing.
meanings.sent3: He was so immersed in playing video games that he forgot to eat dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was immersed in thoughts of the upcoming exam, making it hard to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: The child was immersed in building a sandcastle, oblivious to the world around him.

meanings.definition: Completely covered or submerged in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sponge became fully immersed in the soapy water, ready for cleaning.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer was immersed in the refreshing pool, enjoying the cool water on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The toy boat accidentally got immersed in the bathtub, creating a mini adventure for the child.
meanings.sent4: The sunken ship lay immersed in the depths of the ocean, a silent witness to history.
meanings.sent5: The vegetables were immersed in boiling water to cook them quickly for dinner.

meanings.definition: Deeply absorbed or engrossed in something.
meanings.sent1: The students were immersed in the fascinating story their teacher was telling.
meanings.sent2: She was so immersed in the movie that she didn't hear her phone ringing.
meanings.sent3: The detective was immersed in solving the mystery, trying to connect all the clues.
meanings.sent4: The audience was immersed in the music, swaying to the rhythm of the melody.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was immersed in the research, eager to discover new findings in the lab.
